TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content:
The above bug is an <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> bug.  I will advise the author.

In particular, this line here is causing it.  The render queue for those clouds is too high:

![bug.png](https://img.techpowerup.org/200329/bug.png)

In the meantime, I have a working build of <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> that integrates nicely with my scatterer.  I won't openly distribute it, but if you PM me and promise to send reports to me and not the author, I might share it with you.  Hopefully we'll have an official update of some kind soon.

Source for my pull request will be up shortly.

**Edited <time datetime="2020-03-29T03:00:18Z" title="03/29/2020 03:00  AM" data-short="4 yr">March 29, 2020</time> by R-T-B**

> 
> 
> On 3/27/2020 at 6:34 AM, RagingNerd said:
> 
> 
> Mind helping me through the process of making it look like a real atmosphere?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I have absolutely no idea what I'm doing. The pale blue is just what appears when I launch the game.
> 

Someone posted some real views of the Earth from Space a few pages back after your previous comment about the milky atmosphere.  You might want to check those out.  Long story short, Scatterer is actually pretty close to the real atmosphere (note, as mentioned above, Kerbin in the main menu is *slightly* more saturated then the ingame version).

Just realized you used romanticism and photoshoped it.

![300px-Caspar_David_Friedrich_-_Wanderer_above_the_sea_of_fog.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b9/Caspar_David_Friedrich_-_Wanderer_above_the_sea_of_fog.jpg/300px-Caspar_David_Friedrich_-_Wanderer_above_the_sea_of_fog.jpg)

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Patar2154 said:
> 
> 
> Just realized you used romanticism and photoshoped it.
> 

Yep, I always loved this painting.

Hello all.

Unreleated to Scatterer, but as a lot of us using scatterer are using other visual mods relating to lighting, etc, I thought I'd make you al aware I have made a patched branch of the above <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> buggy source.  It logs itself differently, so the author will know I made/built/patched it.  Source is on my girhub [here](https://github.com/R-T-B/EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements), releases there as well.  Same license as standard <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>.

It fixes the "Rocket plume blending with and intensely lighting clouds" bug that some of you thought was a scatterer bug.  Once I saw it, I couldn't unsee it, and am providing this until my bug report to the author is accepted.

Download at Github here: [https://github.com/R-T-B/EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements/releases](https://github.com/R-T-B/EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements/releases)

Or at my server here:  [http://glacialsoftware.net/ScattererBuilds/PATCHED_EVE_BUILDS/](http://glacialsoftware.net/ScattererBuilds/PATCHED_EVE_BUILDS/)

Remember, bug reports to me for these builds, no one else.  I'll be sure they get to the right people (and/or, fix my own issues, lol).

I feel like [@R-T-B](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/200868-r-t-b/) deserves a round of applause for fixing KSP's visual mods in 1.9.1. Major kudos to you, Evil Frog Priest.

The Frog Persona comes from techpowerup, where I built it up acting as a frog-journalist hybrid for many years before going partially insane and doing what I do now:  a lot of nothing.  Good free time though.

I have other builds and bugfixes (like a 1.9.1 ready Principia) but I try to get a hold of the authors first if they seem remotely present (and Principias are).  Don't want to look like a turf-stealer or something.

Thanks all. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

But glad I'm helpful for now, lol.

KSP log file from your KSP directory root please, it will help me see what's happening (grab it right after you try to do the correct sunflares).

Also a link to the sunflares you want to use could be helpful.
